['played on steam is a better game than its predecessor all the gameplay related qualms one might have with the first game are sufficiently squashed in this game party leader can faint combat opens up earlier there are more places to explore there s some nice post game stuffs etc the paradigm stagger system is still the most underrated combat system in the series that s infinitely hindered by the words auto battle it s the most kinetic and engaging version of rock paper scissors in gaming and that can be fun too the story doesn t really pick up so naturally from the last game nor does it follow its own rules of time travel but i d be hard pressed to say that the story is a mess or hard to follow common critiques it s actually very easy to follow and contains a pretty good cast of characters whether the original party should have been shafted in favor of the new characters we focus on is a discussion unrelated to the quality of the game itself the music outstanding except for that one rap song wtf was that it s a hard recommend but an overall thumbs up because an the greatest hurdle into this game is finishing itself but if you liked as i did then you ll feel pretty alright getting to paradigm shift on some fools for a few more snow still sucks ']

['updated review for a story and gameplay perspective this is one of my favorite final fantasy games and my top pick in the ffxiii trilogy you can re explore various areas at different points of time recruit monsters as allies and there s a ton of dlc and side story content to explore outside the main game on the subject of allies the system gets really complex allowing you to not only level up monsters but also combine them to absorb certain abilities into certain other monsters it s surprisingly complex and something i really like about this game there are two key negatives that led to a negative overall review dlc and technical on the dlc side some of the original dlc is completely absent notably a few costumes and most of the weapons additionally the story dlc has been moved from chapter to post game i don t necessarilly dislike this change but it does take away content that was previously available from a technical view the game crashes a lot turns out the game only allocates itself of ram but sometimes needs more whenever this happens the game crashes this can be fixed with community patches but hasn t received any formal patch to address it similarly you can t select your display monitor on a multi monitor display and you re limited to and no or support when in windowed mode ultimately the console experience for this game is just a better one and this port fell short ']

['wow i am not sure why there are so many negative reviews here since my game run smoothly with no crash so far i write this with hours on the clock and i finish alomst everything in the game maybe they have already patched things up anyway as for the game itself it may depend on your personal preference some may say this is not a good game of the series but i personally think the story extended smartly and it is actually interesting i like the development and game mechanic that they don t change too much but it is not completely the same as ffxiii so game play still seems fresh but familiar you can look up some game play demo on youtube and you will see why the port control is as the same as ffxiii in the sense that you don t really need gamepad to play and keyboard mouse control are implement perfectly at least for me never once i though oh i wish i have gamepad and never once i feel awkward while using keyboard mouse to play very easy to get used to about game crashes i dunno i have never had this issue but seems like a lot of people have it so i would say it might be up to your computer conclusion if you like ffxiii you won t regret grabbing this game but i would suggest playing around just until you are sure you have no crash issue within refundable time edit according to the comment i think it is hours game play or weeks of purchase in any case please look it up anyway in case they have change policy after i write this review since it seems most of the negative reviews are about game port compatibility and not the game itself ']

['if you like playing games where you can explore a beautifully crafted world with a proper story behind it then you will enjoy ff you feel like you are really getting to know serah and noel throughout the game s main story there s plenty of supplementary action chatacter building and lore to learn in the side quests as well whilst you couldn t really class it as a sandbox environment there s still a bit of room for exploration and as mentioned lots to do aside from the main story while it may be a sequel to ff xiii it is not necessary to have played that game first as ff stands fine on its own you are suitably filled in on the events in the previous game the music is very wide ranging in its style but there are some truly spellbinding moments where you can clearly tell a lot of thought has gone into the creative process and the team behind the game have worked together to create instances where you are seemingly locked into a moment in time a fitting counterpoint to all the travelling through the historia crux that you do during the game the gameplay itself isn t particularly exciting in my opinion it can get quite repetitive but there s lots of room for variety in your approach to battles with the various paradigm packs and monsters but i get the impression that for the creators of ff the gameplay itself is arguably one of the lesser important elements after spending hours on the game i have come to the conclusion that ff at its core isn t about grinding monsters and attaining level in everything you can by all means grind away and many players will end up doing this if they are struggling with a particular boss battle so that they can advance in the game and find out the next chapter of the story and enrich their view of the world s that ff takes place in because that s what this game is about telling a story and building world full of rich detail and history for this story to take place in caveat the port is a bit buggy such that you will almost definitely have to actively take action to change some settings on your pc to ensure you can reliably run the game without any major issues ']

['writing this review after hours into re playing on the pc version storyline and gameplay wise it is a great improvement compared to the first one they somewhat fixed the linearity which was a problem in ffxiii the game is a bit more open world but still pretty straight forward in terms of traveling etc it is definitely however not a straight lined map with no town npc interactions they also did a really good job in my opinion with the storyline that is still a bit confusing but not as bad as the first one keep in mind that the store page is somewhat misleading as they only show you screenshots of lightning but the main character in this game is serah and the new character noel graphics and performance wise it is a bit disappointing but i don t believe it is detrimental to the gameplay i have an gtx oc and gb of ram and i frequently have frame drops to below i believe people with a much higher end pc experience the same problem if not worse the game still requires patching and optimization so if you are looking for a drastic change in performance compared to the first one i don t recommend you buy it just yet they allow you to change the game resolution and shadow resolution i don t really have much knowledge whether the in game resolution is set to native but to me it just looks like a stretched out when i set it to i could be wrong overall i still think it s a good change compared to the console version but can definitely be improved some more tl dr if you don t care too much about performance issue it s not great but not detrimental to the gameplay and are looking forward to improved gameplay open world more npc interactions etc and a good storyline i definitely recommend buying it however if sudden frame drops and stretched out resolution bothers you i recommend you wait for the devs to fix it before buying this game ']

['in many ways final fantasy is a great sequel intending to fix many of the issues that fans had with the original game combat is refined with more reward for experimentation the non linear approach also fits the narrative of a time travelling adventure well creating a larger sense of player freedom it isn t as impressive or grandeur as xiii but ends up being a more enjoyable game overall the art style still looks beautiful to this day and the score is utterly magnificent if there is one thing the xiii series can t be faulted for it s the ability to evoke an emotion or atmosphere so readily with its soundtrack however the narrative is told awfully almost all the dialogue is expository and honestly does a bad job at explaining what is happening regardless while the linear design of the original game allowed for such a rich world to be built and i m sure the intermittent nature of this sequel meant story would have less focus there is no excuse for how blatantly poor the game is at conveying its own plot if it was left just up to this final fantasy would be an easy recommendation for fans of xiii and the franchise unfortunately this port is awful while the first game definitely had its issues they are magnified in this release stuttering freezing bad optimisation and severe instances of crashing in a game that already had a particularly bad auto save are frustrations that make this by far the worst platform to play on sadly these issues are quite common in many of square s releases to pc and the main reason why review scores of this game on steam are so low until such problems are fixed i can t recommend this these issues go far beyond what is acceptable and ruin what is otherwise a very good rpg ']

['i will not comment on the port and issues that arise from them because firstly you can fix it by applying patches and secondly i did not face many problems here besides tiny frame hangs every once in a while i m here to tell you why this game is great enough to not warrant a mixed rating this is as everyone says a definite improvement over ffxiii in every way except the story the combat got more strategic and it does not hold your hand more it does however present you with the opportunity to become overpowered if you choose to put time into it opportunity something that ffxiii surely missed on being a linear adventure gives you so much freedom that its story suffers for it this game allows you to visit many locations in different time periods and even to restart them whenever you feel like it in fact there is so much freedom that it compelled me to almost it not counting a few achievements while i wanted to be done with xiii as soon as possible there s also a pokemon esque smt aspect to it giving you another huge layer of freedom when building up your third member of the party story wise it s a little disjointed and chaotic you have to really think about it in order to truly understand the storyline as you have to jump through time a lot due to the time travelling nature of the game you will understand the main plot but will probably miss out on a lot of background detail and worldbuilding due to the way it s presented to you the characters are an improvement over xiii while i liked xiii s characters generally there are some issues there with some especially vanille and snow though as another side note i believe snow is fine solely due to the fact that he is a tank and a tank should be crazy reckless and willing to jump into a pit of demons just to protect his party serah is a reserved and logical person while noel is the slightly more rash of the two however they both make no dumb decisions and are very relatable noel in particular is a really likable character the main villain is a tragic character if you can look past his over the top design he has an interesting unique underlying motivation and his theme is absolutely dope speaking of the villain s theme the music here is amazing i don t know what type of a earless billie eilish listening imbecile you have to be to not enjoy the magnificent soundtracks in final fantasy games this one is no exception it does along with the rest of the games in the lightning saga feature a more electronic take and in particular even uses a lot of vocal tracks which give it a unique feel and perfectly builds up the apocalyptic techno fantasy landscapes i especially enjoy the oerba dying world themes i could gush over this thing even more but i doubt anyone read this far anyway the point stands this is an excellent game and a very wrongfully judged one it has flaws rarely anything doesn t but it manages to take the theme of ffxiii and rebuild it into a thoroughly open enjoyable experience with an unforgettable techno fantasy adventure tl dr open beautiful atmospheric and an overall epic adventure full of very interesting takes on time travel this is the terminator to the ffxiii s terminator ']

['the biggest issue i ve had this time isn t the linearity of the game but the pc port i consider my computer as very good yet i ve had few problems the most annoying one would be the lack of surround sound support and i didn t find a way to at least make it work with my razer headset video stutter in cutscenes is still there and there are few locations where i ve had lower fps than i m ok with the story yet again feels as an interactive anime world truly well written and astoundingly presented it felt a bit shattered at first but that s the part of don t lead the way for the players too much plus if you are fan of time travelling and consequences of changing things in the past future you may love this one character progress is more free aswell and i don t think you can actually develop your characters so badly you won t be able to finish the game if you don t grind a lot it will be hard though i ve spent a lot of time in final battles that were also close to death it wasn t just about not enough damage the battle system was slightly improved ok it s nearly the same but there is one big but for me the pre emptive strike finally does not start an hour long animation of hitting every little enemy instead it s like one quick blitz attack and that s it i was missing characters though from the start to the end you ll be forced to play with noel and serah yeah and the mog some monster serah is able to capture and also cinematics there really is only the opening and ending everything else are just regular cutscenes i think but well i don t think this game was as good as the first one story wise because it didn t have that much touching moments but it s still final fantasy and a very good game i definitely recommend this kupo ']

['this game was a perfect sequel to final fantasy xiii it s like square took notes on everything people didn t like and went okay let s fix this you want streamlined item crafting checkyou want quick time events in cut scenes checkyou want streamlined chrystarium and role development checkit really feels like they bumped up the drop rates for the rare items and there are lots of accessories that increase your drop rates as well if you like to farm items your third character party member is a monster you can capture monsters as you fight them and add them to your party once captured it s a really fun mechanic despite not having much screen time they really played up lightning as a character into such a badass that she gets mistaken for the goddess herself i hear that you can add her to your party but after hours with this game i personally think it might just be a rumour all in all i can t recommend this game enough for people who played xiii and still want to spend more time on gran pulse this is the sequel xiii deserved and even with some of it s flaws the game stands out in different ways than it s predecessor while still holding on to what was good about ffxiii tldr if you liked xiii enough to consider the sequel do yourself a favour and pick this game up it s such an improvement while staying true to the original ']

['tl dr if you want to play lightning returns and want to know about the story beforehand i recommend skipping this broken game and reading a summary instead i have three big qualms about this game one involving the pc port the other two involving the gameplay and its story firstly about the pc port it is horribly bad optimized and i m saying this after they had plenty of time patching the game but it seems this is as good as they re gonna make it the game runs on a very very weird dynamic fps capping system that generally limits your framerate very low so it doesn t spike sometimes far lower than what you consider okay to look at the community has found a way to remove this framerate limiter greatly increasing the potential fps you will have however this will cause audio and animation during cutscenes to go out of sync if the framerate drops below making most of them ridiculously stupid if they happen in a performance intense area secondly the gameplay i ve never been fond of xiii s active time battle system which frankly hasn t changed very much in this game making this already a minus what s more is that most of the time it feels like you re fighting unnecessary encounters partly unrelated to the situation the whole time travelling system is also very confusing and annoying to do gating you from progressing by having to go back and finding wild artifacts or other keys in order to progress through the main story i suppose this was an attempt to go away from xiii s linear world but it s not better at all making it more annoying if anything and lastly the story if you enjoyed the story of ffxiii then you probably won t feel at home here apart from starting off somewhere near the ending of xiii and sharing its characters it s like a fan made alternative universe while i understand that time travelling is playing a major role in this it feels very disconnected from xiii the character relations aren t reflective of xiii either seperating it even more from being a sequel to xiii on top of all that lightning returns almost nullifies everything that happened in and just starts off from an almost completely unrelated universe the only thing the xiii games have in common are characters and modifications of its atb system ']

['does this game improve and innovate on the mechanics of the first game yes is it at times one of the most simultaneously epic yet solemn final fantasy games ever also yes is it a better game than the original perhaps possible spoilers for and ahead first off this game exponentially adds to the lore and mythos of the twin worlds of cocoon and pulse but in doing so dampens the sacrifice that took place at the end of when the game starts we are introduced to the driving force of the first game s narrative and lighting s sister serah farron who has been living on pulse in the town of new bodum shortly after awakening from a dream about her now long missing sister lightning fighting someone at the end of time a time paradox opens yes it s one of those stories and the town is attacked by futuristic monsters and serah meets up with new characters noel and mog the story of the game then centres around serah and noel fighting and closing time paradoxes in an attempt to prevent the now crystalline cocoon from crashing down and ushering in the end of the world overall the story is intriguing and well written in regard to tackling the main themes of despair loneliness and sacrificing the many in order to save the ones you love if not a bit short on the topic of gameplay the paradigm system from has been greatly overhauled now opposed to party members that change based on the story there are only permanent party members serah and noel and the other party slot is occupied by any of creatures you ve captured in battle think less pokemon and more persona as it is luck based who occupies a single paradigm this was a novel inclusion as it makes party compositions feel more unique as you have access to almost every basic enemy to add to your party train and customise with humorous attire but despite this does not make up for not having a third character in the party as all the dialogue tends to be between serah noel and mog who is practically useless gameplay wise other than for completionist purposes overall the lack of a wider party really sells serah s excitement for reuniting with snow who also went missing and noels sense of loneliness being the last person alive in the end of time combat wasn t the only thing that was changed as the chrystarium was also completely overhauled this time rather than progress being tied to story events a new chrystarium would unlock as soon as the old one was completed this made progression feel a lot more fast paced and less like it was intrinsically tied to the plot paradigms also received some updates as now the sen paradigm negates more damage than in and this feature is made apparent from the very start this leads to combat being more fast paced but also more challenging in places one final change to the gameplay formula is that random encounters are back but work on a system more akin to persona than to a traditional final fantasy game where an enemy randomly spawns you have the chance to attack first to gain an advantage or flee and if you get hit by the enemy you start with a disadvantage honestly i prefer this system as it means preemptive strikes are far easier to get as you aren t sat in the gapra whitewood waiting for that bastard behemoth to turn around just for the chance of a preemptive strike not to mention that now you can change the party leader mid fight so now the annoying death of a party leader leading to the loss of a fight in is replaced by the death of a party member nothing more nothing less for the most part the changes to the gameplay are welcome additions in my eyes and help to make the combat more enjoyable and engaging the level design has also been altered for this sequel this time around square really took the criticism of corridor levels to heart and as a consequence the levels and the way they are connected feel way too open this seems like a good idea but now rather than being stuck at the end of a corridor you actually took wrong turns and have gone through different time zones only to find out through a decade old youtube guide that you went through the wrong time portal and went several millennia in the wrong direction as for the area design that is a completely different story final fantasy continues to hold the bar set by its predecessor and in some instances surpasses it conveying not only the state of the world to the player but also the emotions of the characters using the contrast of the same area being perfectly fine in one timeline and utterly demolished in another to sell the urgency of saving cocoon and its inhabitants as a result of your time tampering not only do you save the many lives of cocoon but you also get a glimpse into the more personal effects of your actions with the character of alyssa zaielle who you witness grappling with the knowledge that they themselves are a time paradox and should have died if not for the player altering time now for the real reason anyone would play a final fantasy game the villain caius ballad is the eternal sworn protector of yuel the seeress who is continually fated to die at approximately years old understandably this leaves caius distraught as the one person he loves dearest is ripped from him prematurely leaving countless iterations of him alone caius acts as a foil to noel as they are both people confronted with immense loss but the way they handle it is completely different as where noel sees hope and is seen as a light in the dark caius seeks only chaos and destruction on the topic of chaos i would like to discuss this game s implications on the wider story of the universe with the end if you see the entire party save fang i believe transform into ceith then to shortly later revert back into people tries to explain this by introducing the unseen character of etro the goddess of death who it turns out took pity upon the party and used her powers to revert the party this caused a time paradox which was resolved by lightning being sacrificed and imprisoned by the chaos until the end of time in valhalla which in turn led to the death of etro whose heart the heart of chaos is stored inside caius this is an interesting addition to the lore as it shows that there are beings above the likes of the fal cie who possess the power to rewrite history as none of this was referenced in the first game this makes it feels less planned and more like a slapdash effort especially with bunevelze s introduction in lighting returns after numerous fights with caius and saving the population of cocoon the game s climax takes place as a battle against caius in valhalla at the end of time this leads to either noel killing caius or his suicide based on the player s choice this then leads to the heart of chaos being shattered setting the events of lightning returns into motion like it s predecessor this game has excellent music with a large selection of high energy tracks as well as loads of more typical final fantasy music with each area having an alternate version of the song for when an enemy appears and tries to attack you which helps sell the sense of upcoming action with the next fight like with the area design the ost also contains some more sombre tracks which succeed with selling the emotion of the comparatively darker story overall while this review was fairly positive in its tone i would like to add that there are flaws with the game the actual story is relatively simple and more of a vessel for the interesting themes and during the latter half the game becomes extremely tedious as in without a guide this game would be over hours long levels of tedious it also ends on a cliffhanger that only serves as a way to sell lighting returns which i won t get into but if you liked you should like tis game ']

['despite the best efforts of lightning and her crew the world is once again in danger now it s up to serah mysterious traveler noel and moogling mog to make things right despite putting hours into i m about as equipped to discuss the plot as somebody who has never even heard of the game or final fantasy i guess this title could be compared to previous square games like chrono trigger chrono cross the player must pass through various times and dimensions alleviating paradoxes fighting monsters and getting pushed around by some jerk named caius there are dark moments like chrono but it sticks to characters instead of attempting to juggle like cross i guess that s part of what got me through this game when the story doesn t make a lot of sense at least you can watch the friendship between noel serah grow and realize that they re getting by despite the heaps of bs being tossed their way the battle system is straight outta ffxiii but with numerous changes the most obvious is that the third party member is always a monster pocket monster fans are going to find dozens of creatures to recruit throughout their journey monsters are strengthened via materials and can be infused with others to gain additional skills admittedly i was a little disappointed that monsters adhere to the ffxiii system for example i recruited a giant cactaur but he s not going around using needles on everything he s a synergist so he sticks entirely to buffs i know i know the paradigms are essential to winning in ffxiii but i just oh well on the bright side monsters tend to have unique skills that make them more effective in a given situation than serah noel on the whole is a fair bit easier than its predecessor this is mostly due to the fact that you re actually not limited in how much you can grind since this game is non linear you could go to various optional areas and amass a ton of levels making the story battles trivial aside from a handful of post game dlc fights you ll have to limit yourself if you want a challenge speaking of levels the crystarium got a convoluted revamp you cash in points for stat bonuses to magic to hp etc over time you unlock and level all six roles but your level stats can vary there s a perfect guide floating around to help you figure this mess out while i ended up using guides to have a chance at this game i merely stuck to leveling what i thought would make sense for serah i leveled ravager on the large nodes to boost her magic and with noel commando i probably goofed somewhere and cost myself a good points in an essential stat but i ve done most everything in the game so it isn t that much of an issue in order to get all fragments you re going to be doing a lot of exploring grinding puzzles and stupid pet tricks mog is capable of finding hidden items and can also be thrown to reach faraway objects which you might need a guide to find the puzzles are almost entirely mini games as anyone who has played will tell you the clock puzzles suck most of them aren t that difficult and can be brute forced but there are a few that all but require a website for calculating solutions either take advantage of the tools the internet has made available to you or watch in horror as the pacing dies a painful death your choice the grind isn t quite as bad as ffxiii but expect to spend a lot of time in the archylte steppe fighting the same monsters for potent orbs essences crystals after completing the game all of the major dlc is unlocked in the coliseum players will engage in battle with numerous fan favorites and a few characters from ffxiii i find it amusing that one of the opponents should have been in a boss fight in ffxiii but it never happened because reasons i won t spoil it but if you played ffxiii then you already know who i m talking about you ll want to fight these battles not just because they re quite good but also because you can recruit everyone you defeat the next dlc adventure is a solo battle between lightning and caius lightning has a specific set of roles and is expected to switch between them constantly for example she can use the knight role to become impervious to damage and it s necessary to avoid getting one shotted by a handful of caius s attacks since this dlc doesn t require serah noel you can do it immediately after completing the game to gain a powerful ally sazh s dlc adventure takes place in a casino he s trapped in limbo and his son is nowhere to be found only by gambling can they hope to be re united while the concept sounds sufficiently dark this isn t exactly gambling apocalypse sazh the goal is to acquire fortune medals which can be done in less than minutes by playing texas hold em the casino is also available in the main game though all n s can do is play slots and race their chocobos once i got the items i required i never went back i ll admit i enjoyed my time with this game more than ffxiii noel serah and caius are some of the better jrpg heroes and villains i ve seen trying to make sense of everything is headache inducing but the revamped crystarium and monster raising provided excellent distractions the combat itself also recieved some slight improvements like paradigm shifting being noticeably faster the various areas times dimensions being more than a narrow corridor definitely helped though the quests tend to be of the fetching variety the port still could have been a lot better though i m not nearly as frustrated about it now as was when i started the pc version but square enix isn t getting a passing grade for this one ffxiii and its sequel deserve better ports but i expect lightning returns to be at about the same quality as the previous two pc entries superior to the console versions and not much else ']

['i m a huge fan of final fantasy series maybe not hardcore fan but this is one of my favorite game series and final fantasy in my opinion is one of the worst games in the whole series but that doesn t mean it s bad final fantasy xiii lacked a lot of things which made the game a ff game but i really loved combat in that game while this game retains very similar combat system it simply lacks characters you can t build a team since it has very limited playable characters you play as serah oh how i wanted to play as her it s like dream come true cutie and noel you can have third party member as a captured monster they also can evolve and you have quite a bit of choice which monster you want to use other than that the combat is very similar to ff xiii it s fast but it allows some tactical gameplay and isn t as boring as turn based combat yes i get it turn based combat has a lot more tactical possibilities but most of the time you re fighting regular monsters which are easy to beat and you run into them a lot so waiting each time while clicking one button becomes boring after your fight this time serah and noel embark on a journey to find lightning they travel through time to various locations some being new and some you ve visited in previous game although those locations are quite different when you travel there because of the time period you travel to there are a lot of locations to explore from vast open areas to some weird sci fi like mazes and cities what i loved about the setting was that the game feels pretty dark the worlds you travel to are desolate and the ['this game is more playable after applying the patch exe which allows it to have better framerates now onto the game itself compared to the first better music more streamlined combat fixed issue with high resolutions you can read the notes on each enemy now environments are more detailed and look better voice acting is far better than the first game ending is decent most side quests build the world a bit quick time events they have the idea of time travel but it s lazily implemented the most you get is a tint and maybe some thunder or snow when going a hundred years in the future lame although academia was well done it feels like this game story was written then they hacked it up so it fit with the first game you ll also get tired of hearing the words timeline and paradox by the end of this game only main characters and they barely get developed story is mostly boring until late in the game long load times exacerbated by the fact that in order to get fragments you have to repeatedly search timelines expect to do a lot of waiting pacing of the story is worse due xiii had a more enjoyable story overall all of the positives don t outweigh the negatives the gameplay is better but certainly not enough to carry the game with it s lackluster story i only played it due to playing the first game and having already bought the if this was a standalone game i would have quit halfway through ']

['as a spinoff it s not everyone s final fantasy but it does attempt to rectify some of the problems that xiii had first the story which is a weakness i do not believe or lightning returns should have ll be traveling through time it continues after xiii and retcons the happy ending series heroine lightning has disappeared and as her younger sister serah the only one who seems to remember her you need to team up with noel the last survivor of humanity in the far off future to find the source of a timeline disturbance and fix it the combat is similar to xiii which is a more dynamic version of the atb system from many other ff games the difference here is that you always play as the same two characters plus your choice of captured monster in this game you can recruit enemy monsters each with a specific combat role medic physical attacker magic attacker etc as opposed to serah and noel who can change roles you can change combat roles for your party on the fly during battle to react to the situation exploration is limited each area is self contained and you travel between each area time via a menu some locations are used more than once and you can explore them in different times to end if memory serves there is a meaty postgame but it does get slow and annoying at times but not as slow as ffxiii and the fragment that has you logging battles with every single monster will be ['a beautiful rpg that marks the second chapter of the final fantasy xiii trilogy in a departure from the first game is very non linear you can explore all manner of side areas and progress the story at your own speed but going straight through the story is also perfectly possible and not prohibitively difficult for a player that didn t grind note this game does not run well without modification as square enix did a very sloppy job porting it thankfully this is fixed by unofficial fixes and mods you can find information on those here pros excellent soundtrack and characters story is great beautiful graphics battle system is a lot of funcons one of the temporal rift puzzles the clock solvers are an absolute nightmare and easily the worst design decision in the whole final fantasy xiii series easy for a computer for a solve practically impossible for any normal human google for robert woodward s clock solver to save yourself endless frustration the game could have done a better job of hinting to the player where to find good early monsters the ones given initially are awful and getting decent monsters is very much key to the battle system in it s not a big deal but something that could ve been better much like ffxiii this game was given an extremely sloppy port by square enix not only does it run badly out of the box but will frequently crash thankfully you can fix all this with unofficial mods and game fixes which are all fantastic and require little effort to install you can find information about them here note that console versions of are locked to and so playing it on steam with mods and fixes is much better performance wise as you can run it at with']

['after faithfully enduring some of the performance and gameplay hiccups in the final fantasy port i expected final fantasy to have most of these issues resolved this is not the case in fact square enix has taken one step forward but two steps back in the performance department with this pc port first of all my computer exceeds the recommended specs in every aspect therefore hardware should not be an issue this being said frame rates are not stable and fluctuate between and fps despite square enix promising fps gaming rain is rendered poorly in this game and appears white and pixelated the good news is that graphics settings are now adjustable in the game launcher the available settings are screen settings resolution sound settings shadow resolution and anti aliasing the bad news is that lowering these settings does absolutely nothing to alleviate performance issues i ve tried adjusting settings via the game launcher and my graphics card driver to no avail no matter how low i set my graphics settings my frame rate is unstable or is locked at fps in many areas overall final fantasy while a solid console game is still not up to par as a pc port i thought square enix would have their act together by now since they have had experience porting several other final fantasy titles to pc the shoddy performance is just too hard to ignore especially since square enix promised fps gaming but actually fps is a lot closer to reality square enix should have taken more time to port this game and check for performance issues i would rather have played a polished game at a later date than a shoddy one at an earlier date until square enix fixes these glaring performances problems i cannot recommend this game update so i have looked into the missing dlc issue and apparently the dlcs are included in the game but for some reason they do not unlock until the game is beaten which was not the case with the console version i apologize for the confusion in my previous review ']

['my favorite final fantasies are vi ix and xii and i hated ffxiii if you have similar tastes you might find this review useful i hated the first ffxiii it was awful i wrote a review for it explaining why i have this opinion this game is much better it fixes a lot of the problems the first game had the structure is much better there s actual exploration now instead of just straight halways and more side content besides just killing monsters after long tedious walks combat and customization is also better the two main characters are pretty static with what you can do with them but the third party member a monster is up to you and you can do a lot with it combat is also faster in the original game sometimes i didn t even want to paradigm shift because the animation was so long animations are faster and this game doesn t have trash mobs with huge hp pools like the first game this is a huge quality of life improvement they also got rid of the awful weapon accesory upgrade system you just get weapons or accessories and that s it the complicated and opaque upgrade system from the previous game did not make it more complex or interesting just more annoying these were my main gripes with the original game the fixes this game brings make it a much more enjoyable experience if you played ffxiii saw a decent game there screwed by poor design decisions and wish it were better then this is the game you want hell you don t even need to play the first game this one comes with explanations of what happened in the first game if you want to watch read about it ']

['before everything i d like to say i won t consider the quality of the port in my rating but only how good the game is talking about the port it is bad garbage even and it is a shame that a company steam cloud turned off as the game crash if the cloud is on now that we re done talking about how crap the port is i can tell my opinion on the game have to say i wasn t expecting much playing this game after playing the first one that i heavily disliked but to my surprise this game was actually better in many ways it fix most of the problems of the first game even the famous linearity problem you ll be more emotionally invested in the game if you play the first one before even if you don t like those characters the two protagonists are new tho half new in serah s case the story that was one of my biggest complain about the first game and is now quite good actually it was enjoyable maybe a bit too much sometimes but really i liked the journey it was definitely interesting also there is finally a memorable villain character in the game and i enjoyed it the two mains characters aren t awful either serah isn t the most interesting but i found noel quite good and the mystery around him is definitely a big part of why the game is good the gameplay is very similar to the first game they fixed the gameover if your main character die which help a lot to not be frustrated the game is easier aswell which might not be the best for everyone and they added a monster taming part in the game that while not awful didn t really interest me that much the monster variety in the game isn t better as well the levels are less greyish and much more enjoyable i had a huge problems with the maps of the first game i enjoyed a lot those of this one except one of the last map that you ll have the pleasure to see if you play the game there is more post game content than the first game but it s shorter less running around less need to be grinding to be able to defeat monsters and again a way less difficult game you need less strategy to do the bosses which is probably a worse thing it doesn t push the fighting system as much as the first game does but i d say overall it s better again you have different task to do many ways to do you collect fragment to complete the game you xp with each of them you have mini games and a casino there are cities and it feels like there is life unlike the first game again where you only fight from the beginning to the end and there is no soul to be seen the dlc aren t good don t expect anything great out of them maybe the colisseum actually have it and you have to die and retry to be able to succeed in it or maybe if you re good enough you can find a challenge in it but thats pushing it heavily sazh s dlc is about minigames and isn t very interesting either i guess it s nice for a change of pace sometimes but you unlock it after the ending of the game and the story is very barebone in it i wouldn t call it a nice dlc not at all overall ['so i feel this is an unnecessary sequel because ff xiii ended perfectly with no lose ends but i give it a positive review because even though it is unneeded the story is actually quite good and they ve changed up the gameplay enough to make it go from unbearably boring to tolerable the stupid interrupting animations when you switch paradigms are gone and the problem of enemies having bazillion hp is not as bad as in xiii and since this is a much shorter game you level up much faster eliminating most of the grinding required the biggest improvement though is the levels they are now much more open instead of the single hallways of xiii and feel great to explore the story as i ve said is pretty good though i would ve liked it more if the cast of the previous game had more screentime especially snow since the whole game of xiii was about him saving serah and now he almost isn t in this game also the ending was very very unexpected oh and the pc port is just as terrible as the previous game no quit button barebones settings horrendous volume mixing where you can t hear the dialogue properly and performance issues but i guess that is to be expected of square enix at this point get all the necessary mods and it ll make your experience slightly better if you feel like playing more ff xiii then this is more of it but improved and if you feel like xiii is a complete story you can skip this entirely as well with no issues ']

['final fantasy is a decent good jrpg but a subpar final fantasy game it continues to tow the line of deviation from what made the core series so great interesting backstories and adventuring prospects and an overall cohesive main story despite this it is still a better game than ffxiii and its two main characters actually have significant character development relative to ffxiii at least this game although graphically stunning is lacking substance and albeit improving on some of the linearity of ffxiii it is still not of the same caliber of other final fantasy games and is a forgettable experience that being said with the exception of some of the developments in ffxiii lightning returns aka much of this game can retroactively be ignored ffxiii lightning returns is arguably the strongest installment in the trilogy both gameplay and story wise the story in this game is disjointed so much that playing metal gear solid before any of the others will logically make more sense than some of the components of this game gameplay wise its minimalist approach isn t all bad you have two main playable characters serah and noel and an captured monster that assists as a third member the combat as a result offers more complexity than albeit still is rudimentary the exploration involves a variety of areas not bound by the linear connections that ffxiii s were and as such you get more opportunities to adventure you will have an enjoyable experience facing off against the classic assortment of ff foes and a few unique new ones it should be noted as stated prior that much of the cast of the previous game is not playable and lightning whom i d consider as the saving grace in ffxiii has behind the scenes role in this game despite much of the plot relating to her overall the gameplay is worth picking this game up for alone if you can tolerate the subpar storytelling and disjointed story i can t recommend this as a final fantasy game but i can recommend it as a jrpg at its core its still an enjoyable experience that you will find investing many hours in as you continue your adventure in the ffxiii universe ']

[' note turn off steam cloud auto saves before playing there is a bug that causes the game to crash if it is on it occurred for me about hours in this steam port is well known for being a technical mess but outside of serious frame drops within the first hour and the cloud save crash bug i had no problems everything ran fine with a few dropped frames here and there but still perfectly enjoyable as for the the game itself it improves upon most of its predecessor s deficiencies there is plenty of choice in where to take your adventure gone is the hour long corridor to start the game and instead we get to jump around several small hub sized worlds there are plenty of places to go and each of them requires a few return trips to complete everything unfortunately many of those places are just the same location at a different time which makes finding everything a bit of a nightmare as you might have a clue as to where to check for something but when you have to check the same spot in different eras it becomes a wild goose chase combat got some tweaks too most notably the initial paradigm shift no longer has a long animation that stalls out combat for an extended period of time which is a very nice quality of life update otherwise you now only have party members in the protagonists noel and serah along with an interchangeable monster in the party slot that you can pick up pokemon style it still felt good like did but with less varied nuance as noel and serah have defined skill sets with the best support abilities being sequestered onto rare or late game monsters so your strategies are somewhat limited although the game tends to be somewhat easy so not being able to rotate through characters of varying specialties from the first game isn t as much of a hindrance in general i would say this game is good for you if you liked the gameplay of the first but wanted something more open this one is my favorite of the trilogy but i m a sucker for collect a thons and it s quite easy to adapt to the combat style of this game after playing the original ']

['short version it s better than xiii with a somehow more straightforward story and an emotional core about the value of life determining your own destiny highs are much higher than xiii s combine that with the game giving you access to xiii s combat system s full potential from the get go great as always music is worth playing if you managed to get through xiii hell skipping xiii jumping straight to wouldn t be the worst idea given the story does sideline most of the first game s main cast focuses on new characters and serah but she was a crystal for most of xiii anyway now i ll have to see if lightning returns keeps up this momentum especially given that cliffhanger long version in many ways final fantasy is a product of its circumstances it as well as its sequel lightning returns review coming soon is a game that mainly exists due to the calamitous launch of final fantasy xiv doing a lot of damage to the company the need to recoup the money lost on that disaster somehow and with final fantasy versus xiii still deep in development hell and still a couple of years away from being turned into final fantasy xv and xiv being in no position to do so on its own without an expensive ground up rebuilding of the game square ended up deciding that cashing in on the commercial success of final fantasy xiii making a sequel or two to it that heavily reused technology assets from xiii was the best option it is also a product of its circumstances due to its design choices which were a mix of walking back things people hated about xiii working within a more limited budget due to square enix s financial troubles at the time due to the aforementioned failure of ffxiv a then recent acquisition of eidos and their studios ex crystal dynamics eidos montreal following design trends of the late era of gaming for instance the linear structure of xiii is replaced with a much more open ended one where you can play most missions during the middle portion of the game in any order you please although the cutscenes do feel written with a particular order in mind there are also much fewer pre rendered cinematics than xiii down to that book end the story plus a couple of extensions of xiii s ending cinematic whether this decrease is down to budgetary restrictions the short for an rpg development cycle leaving little time for more cinematics a desire to cram the entire game onto a single xbox dvd the first game was made with the blu ray discs in mind the port had to be split across dvds as a result of all the pre rendered cinematics and even then they were of a lower resolution bitrate different video format than the cutscenes the xbox one backcompat versions have cutscenes encoded in a proprietary sony developed format reencoded in bink video for the xbox one while the xbox pc have cutscenes in the bink video format that are highly compressed or a combination of the above is unclear but the end result is the same the visuals while pretty good for are also mostly just coasting off of reused assets from xiii presumably another result of the circumstances of this game s creation although what new assets are present are some of the best looking things in the entire game and do hold up against other games of that year like uncharted drake s deception the combat is a strange topic for me with regards to this game on one hand not much has changed compared to xiii with the biggest changes being the ability to change party leaders mid fight the addition of a pokemon persona esque monster catching mechanic almost certainly to make up for the lack of a character to fill that third slot due to noel serah being the only two protagonists but on the other hand i also enjoyed combat a lot more than xiii s i actually rage quit xiii almost halfway through because of the combat to be honest i can t quite put my finger on why but i think it s related to how gives you access to the full potential of its combat system early whereas xiii consistently leaves you with only two party members until past the halfway point of the game by which point many players myself included will have quit that or the drastically reduced difficulty could also be that as for the story it s a significant improvement over xiii the presence of a clear antagonist throughout the story whereas xiii didn t really have one until well into the act who has a clear goal helps give the story clearer stakes a persistent emotional throughline said emotional throughline is focused around of this game s new characters noel kriess one of the protagonists along with serah caius ballad the main antagonist yeul a young girl who can see the future changes to the timeline at the cost of a drastically shortened lifespan eternal reincarnation and caius s charge and made me to tear up numerous times it s not perfect though this game s time travel rules are very convoluted for example the game makes a big deal about how changing the future changes the past but they also allow players to revisit timelines that should have been overwritten by such changes for example there are two versions of academia circa af af being short for after the fall of cocoon you can visit in the game both of them are accessible whenever you please once you ve unlocked them presumably for gameplay reasons due to this game s non linear structure overall i liked it though one thing i should note is that the pc port of this game is a mess it s unstable has performance issues no matter what hardware you run is prone to crashing fortunately though there are mods out there that fix these issues this steam guide should help you get this game to a more stable state on pc if you d rather not deal with mods i d suggest playing the xbox version on an xbox one one x xbox series x or series s instead for a better out of the box experience conclusion final fantasy is a step forward from the first game but is very much an iterative sequel at least the story is surprisingly good for a game slapped together in less than years to keep a company afloat ratings creative score story gameplay voice acting art direction score graphics audio performance pretty good graphics for its day but the pc port is terrible business practices score not terrible but there was a lot of dlc for this game including some bizarre assassin s creed mass effect crossover costumes overall score my thoughts on a game s overall quality doesn t consider the business practices unless they are detrimental to the experience ']

['given the mixed reception the final fantasy series seems to be getting about its ports i thought i d throw my opinion in on this aswell as a game final fantasy is somewhat of an improvement on its ['there s a lot to be said about the final fantasy xiii series of games and a lot to debate about some love it some hate it if you dig your rpgs to be a little more action oriented and faster paced will be right up your alley after you play through xiii first as this is a direct continuation of that story line for a game from built for hardware from it s a pretty game sadly concerning the graphics performance of this title is my big and only gripe the pc version is not well optimized and has some pretty wacky stuff going on you ll notice that the features of the game specify that the title sports a framerate and that s technically true but misleading in how one would expect first of all you re going to need a decently beefy rig to play this game smoothly at due to the pitiful optimation for pc second of all yes you might hit fps here or there but the internal engine applies restrictive frame limiters at multiple points so don t expect that frame rate to stick any cutscene shot that focuses on noel runs nice and smooth at shift to serah or any other character hard drop to running around the map at a nice before it loads a new area and you ve got another drop battle start drop to until the victory animation then snap back to my system is not being taxed mind you it s just how the game operates which is disappointing xiii did not have this problem on my end save for some cutscenes that were hard limited to fps here and there the soundtrack is amazing wide variety of styles and genres there s plenty of tracks that hit the right emotional beats to go with the story and lots of great blood pumping battle tunes to get you into the fight ready to take on the world the story is great not entirely needed as a follow up to xiii as it feels pretty shoe horned in to make some more money but it s serviceable and enjoyable it s nice to play as the damsel in distress from the first game and noel is a good companion and a welcome addition to the cast fun rpg great experience and while far from being the pc port it could have been it is the superior version to the console editions ']

['i started off really enjoying and i began playing it immediately after having finished xiii unfortunately this promising start is betrayed there is a serious lack of compelling characters in your party literally it s just serah and noel and then the third slot is made up from whatever trash mobs you unlock through battle the story and it s delivery is almost entirely different from xiii it is a completely fragmented trip through segmented areas and points in time often overlapping and it feels like a spaghetti mess to try to figure out where to go next or what to do coupled with the necessary back tracking it makes progressing through the story a total chore also the crystarium has been imo unnecessarily reinvented this time for your two characters you are spending your cp points for all your specs across constellations rather than having individual trees for each role this feels on the surface to allow more options to spec in to other roles however picking up a new role does not seem to provide any discount to the early abilities so it feels wasteful to explore in to a new role as you need those points to continue progressing your other roles performance isn t anything to brag about either it s still a good looking game as is xiii there are moments in both games that are visually stunning even today however the game would experience periods of extreme frame drops both in combat and while exploring when otherwise it s running maxed out at a locked i also made sure that i was going through the full upgrade patching from the pcgamingwiki article i got to a point in the game where i had two bosses in completely different timelines to defeat and both of them would one shot my main characters even when they are sentinels it felt like i had to put a lot of effort in to unlocking minimal progress the fragmented and disjointed time paradox of a story is so difficult to follow and the game knows this because it attempts to provide you a full recap of events every time you load the game and there are also long scrolling audio descriptions of every one of the games areas time periods i m sure if i kept bashing my head against it i could figure it out but i m not sure i want to at this stage i enjoyed switching out and re calibrating my party in xiii to find the perfect strategy to beat bosses etc but in this feels hampered by having to constantly level up new trash mobs to maintain your skills and abilities some of which don t even learn the same spells i ve been using the same healing mob since the beginning of the game because only one other medic mob has been acquired and it does not seem to learn esuna or other useful spells at least as i can see it now again the game is attempting to answer criticisms of the first game being too linear not having enough options etc but failing in it s execution can only recommend this one if you are obsessed with xiii and desperately want to play through to see it all otherwise just watch a story recap i really enjoyed xiii lightning is probably my favourite ff character but to me it feels like the fixes for the broken elements in the first game actually detract from the enjoyment of the sequel ']

['does a great job of improving upon the gameplay of its predecessor it is a direct sequel of ffxiii although the story is radically different without giving away too much there is some divine intervention the results of which cause damage to the timeline alters history and allows a select few to use mysterious time gates that have appeared throughout the timeline serah with the help of noel a boy from the far future is one such person i loved the whole concept of how the story unfolds in this game instead of a world map you get a time gate map seen from outside time where you can pick and choose places and times to go to based on what gates you have unlocked granted there is going to be some recycled content in terms of maps but there are quite a few new ones so it doesn t grate on your experience so much academia is stunning in terms of its size and it has probably the largest number of people you are likely to see at one time in a ff title that is not in a cutscene naturally you can expect a framerate hit here valhalla is impressive as well but sadly only available in the intro scenes but augusta tower and noel s timezone help give it some variety and new material too enemies are probably going to irritate some folks for its lack of new material with maybe one or two new creations and everything else having already existed from ffxiii there is a notable lack of superbosses as well unless you include the dlc battles which partly helps to make up for this but some of the best fun to be had with battles comes from the monster capture ability serah sometimes gets a monster crystal from defeated monsters allowing them to be developed like a main character and also allowing myriad customisation with the help of infusions where you can feed a monster to one of your other monsters you can have up to monsters in your paradigm deck meaning only those ones can be active in any given battle and only one at a time to fill out the team of serah noel and a monster i find it weird they use the term monster when most of the time they re just animals anyway you can get some pretty crazy team combos such as three different coloured chocobos chocobos are great fun there s yellow red green blue purple black white gold and silver with so many different chocobos you just knew there d be chocobo racing too right some monster skills in combat actually stand for racing abilities when you enter the chocobo into the races so there s another aspect to building your chocobos that can be quite profitable too with an achievement for filling out your bestiary to you re going to want to look up some guides to help you out monster infusions can be a bit confusing too with abilities having different ranks of importance and terms like red locked and yellow locked abilities so it s worth looking up some builds too where others have already done the work for you music is on par with other ff titles i bought the soundtrack and let me see i have or so favourites from this game not the least of which are and the last of which is kind of death metally kind of funny typically an area will have music then monsters appear and the music will elevate into a remix which is a really neat idea character wise sadly there isn t much of lightning unless you get her crystal from the dlc fight she ll make an appearance here and there but serah is the main protagonist here there s a few costume alternatives for her and noel but not much there are brief cameos from ffxiii characters most notably hope but the new villain of the story is probably the best part voiced by liam o brien one of my all time favourite voice actors who also voiced kain from ffiv the voiced version he has the sort of voice i wish i had you can also play of the game on easy mode if you wish there is but a single enemy raspatil that requires you to kill it on normal but you can change difficulty at any time during the game a word of warning though too on easy there is no loot bonus for battles on normal you get a bonus to items and rare items when you a battle and even normal mode is pretty easy a neat feature is the inclusion of minigames in the form of dimensional rifts the games take the form of join the dots join the crystals of the same colour collect crystals on a grid of tiles that disappear after you walk on them and clock puzzles which aren t nearly as hard as people make them out to be where you have to land on each direction of the clock to finish the puzzle with alternate paradox endings to unlock funny dialogue choices to make serah gushing about snow being totally cool in the first chapter is utterly hilarious throwing your moogle to reach hard to get to treasure messing up the weather in archylte steppe and having your chocobo flash enemies its butt to make them angry has a truckload of things to keep you busy now played times to completion psn pc psnps give your giant cactuar an electric guitar pps give your don tonberry an angel halo ppps give your flan an afro ']

['rating overview turn based rpgthe good good graphics combat remains the same as with one major addition you still assign roles to characters and switch between them freely during battle this time however you can also assign your characters to attack single or multiple enemies giving you more flexibility in how to approach the situation this game solves a lot of issues from the game starts much faster and almost everything is unlocked right from the start each area is interesting and requires exploration leveling your characters is also improved giving you greater flexibility and more choices in how you want to develop your stats the main addition is the ability to capture monsters and include them in your party every monster has a specific role and can be upgraded by using items rewarded after battle you can also infuse monsters together combing different abilities to make some truly devasating monsters given the nature of the game there are multiple endings you can discover after completing the main game collecting fragments allows you to unlock options for the game such as fight more monster collect more experience etc the dlc content allows you to fight high level battles for those looking for a challenge the average take the convoluted stories of a final fantasy game and add time travel and paradoxes despite the craziness of the story it surprisingly does a good job of holding the game together i also enjoyed the characters this time around much easier than the previous game i was able to complete almost all non boss battles without switching any roles many side quests are either fetch quests or kill a monster the game features a few different logic puzzles i found them enjoyable and add a little variety to the gameplay however if you decide to collect all the fragments you must complete many of these types of puzzles and they start to get repetitive the bad one of the worst pc ports and optimization i have played in a very long time especially for a game of this calibre regardless of system specs maintaining fps is near impossible often times going well below fps you can use party apps to help alleviate the issue but this will cause a bunch of other problems now let s say you finally get stable framerates you now have to deal with the crashes crash after cutscenes saving battles doesn t matter the game will crash and it will crash a lot before playing it is highly recommended that you disable steam overlay and cloud saving to help reduce the amount of crashing game lacks exclusive full screen option must edit the windows registry to unlock option no sound volume controls heavy metal rock music during boss battles it does not fit in with the overall theme of the game a character named mog constantly saying kupo conclusion despite improving upon in almost every way its hard to recommend this game given its horrible performance and optimization issues especially during the first few hours of the game this is one of my favorite jprg s and i loved a lot of the additions they added but i can t recommend a game that gave me so many problems ']

['i absolutely hate this game i think in the hours i spent with it i enjoyed about hours at most the biggest highlight is the incredible music and the voice acting of one of the main characters caius liam o brien is a fantastic voice actor and he fit the role perfectly for the only interesting character in the entire game lets go into a deep dive into why i hate this game and why i honestly think pretty much anyone should be avoiding this disaster to begin lets talk about the games concept its very rare for the final fantasy series mainline games to get sequels ff is pretty much the main example and that sequel had a lot of problems as well ff pretty much has some of the most horrific writing i have seen serah and a new character called noel take center stage into a time traveling trip through the locations of ff this is an excellent chance to explore the wide cast of characters and locations in the first game that didn t get explored including serah which was such an incredibly important character to the story now tell me how in a hour game with all these new characters you somehow developed none of them even the most interesting character basically gets left on a bunch of question marks once you finish the game every other character is downright horrible especially the main characters serah has personality and somehow shows less development here compared to ff where she barely said anything for the entire game noel is just supposed to be a hero for heroes sake he isn t interesting or built up he is forced in for the sake of having a new character and mog there is a moogle for no reason that follows you around the game only barely gives a reason as to why he even is in the game this moogle is the most ear grating thing ever and represents everything western fans hate about jrpg voice acting mog is a mascot character through and through and his kupo will haunt me in my nightmares all these characters have no proper role in this entire story they exist for the sake of existing the gameplay got touched on but has the same essence as the first game note i said touched on and not improved the combat did become more fluid with less useless animations but the structure of battles has become much less strategic and much more reactionary the main strategy comes from building a party member most enemies in the game can be captured and then turned into a party member this can completely break the game depending on how you tackle this system if you end up not understanding the system because of how confusing it can be then you end up slogging through the fights if you even understand it a little bit you will end up stomping of the game until the final fights of the game which for some reason are a nightmare i could do every fight in the game nearly blindfolded with the same strategy but for some reason the final area required me to have practically extremely decked out characters even with me spending a bit of extra time on side content and grinding either way i was already starting to get bored with ff battle system towards the end of the first game by the end of this game i grew extremely tired of it also did time travel monster party member and new main character sound overly convoluted and confusing yes well you haven t heard the start of it this game doesn t have a proper vision of what it wants to be it just wants to be everything ff failed to be it tries to be extremely open ended but has to repeat a ton of content and messes up the games balance as a result it constantly throws random plot points and game mechanics at you to try and keep you interested there are puzzle sections that just feels forced the last area has a platforming section with timed jumps that are slow as hell it has a ton of side content which you can completely avoid if you want some of these are things that ff was lacking but overall the execution is horrible so many annoying things were cleaned up from ff that it feels mind boggling that so many other aspects were introduced and made so slow and boring there are a lot of ideas here but clearly not enough time budget to actually realize the complete vision for this game which is sad so much of this would have been really appreciated in ff especially some of the side content like a coliseum or the golden saucer style area that extra content is also one of the few positives i see in this game and it is what allows the ending to somewhat make sense somehow those who are fanatic about ff might be able to find something there in that bonus content maybe i could enjoy this stuff a lot better if the games port also wasn t one of the worst i have ever experienced i had to mess hours before even playing the game with mods to try and fix this mess and it still is so bad that its more common for it to be lagging and stuttering then for it to just run normally if you have any particle effect like rain or sand on screen you can say goodbye to your frames some people even reported corrupted saves which i thankfully didn t get overall this port is a joke and a spit in the face of the fans of the series every time you move between area you have to look at a loading screen for like minute this is unacceptable when you have to move between areas constantly especially if you want to do side quests even something as simple as achievements feel half backed and forced in with descriptions barely describing what you are supposed to do i hate this game but i think those who enjoy this game should be able to play it on pc without these horrible issues even if i enjoyed the game i think i would still not recommend this game purely due to how bad the port is and somehow maybe the worst thing for me is the story it turned the relatively straightforward story of ff into a mess all the themes and character build up of the first game feels like it was spit out in favor of the new cast of characters and what do these new characters and story line offer future heart kupo friends paradox chaos i miss the personal interactions between characters facing a difficult problem ff wasn t perfect but it did a lot right in creating some emotionally gripping scenes those scenes also exist here but they are extremely rare its sad to see because i actually can see a lot of potential in the story it is exciting to see where the world of ff was going after its ending but everything here just feels like a bad fan fiction more then anything else i downright hate this game with every fiber of my body it isn t only bad but it actively makes ff worse and i actually kind of liked that game to some extend this game wastes your time it runs like crap it is boring as hell for a game that tries to teach you so much about the value of time it is ridiculous that it has this much filler content that just straight up wastes your time i can t ever recommend this game even if you want to play all mainline ff games like me i would just recommend seeing a youtube summary or something and avoiding this i entered with not a lot of hope and left with a disgusting after taste somehow the only people i would ever recommend this to are those who completed ff and still somehow wanted more even to those i would give a warning to make sure you understand what you are committing your time and money into ']
