['final fantasy xiii wasn t a bad game just a disappointing one however it had a good conclusion and a sequel wasn t needed or wanted but final fantasy truly feels like a final fantasy game and in almost every way is how xiii should have been in the first place if you enjoyed xiii you ll love if you didn t you ll probably enjoy knowing the story of xiii helps but isn t very important so what s improved the combat is mostly the same when it finally got good in xiii but here you have it in full force in around hours the paradigm shift animations were removed making the combat more fluid there s only permanent party members so the third needed to be filled and that s where the monster capture mechanic comes in using defeated monsters in battle with you where you can level them up and combine them and it s actually fun but the infusion mechanics are a bit complicated you can change you party members in battle and are forced to in you re leader is ko ed but unfortunately you cannot control the monsters that would be cool now the maps are more open and you can revisit almost all areas at almost any time there s more side quests but most of them are just collecting stuff it definitely isn t linear as xiii as a bonus you can also play in slot machines or participate in chocobo races random encounters are back and for the most part you can avoid them if you want leveling weapons and accessories is more traditional using some monster drops to upgrade them one time at best the graphics are a bit improved but i prefered the original animations and locations the music is a bit worse but still pretty good they even added some great songs from xiii and it doesn t feel like cheap but as an addition the story is shorter and weaker but the characters are more interesting some of them my favourite was definitely the new main villain caius ballad what i didn t like was the sequel baiting ending the pc version also includes most of the consoles dlc including another lightning vs caius battle poker and an original card game and my favourite additional boss battles including two very hard superbosses one of them is gilgamesh in the end has a xiii feel but returns with many of the things that make the final fantasy series great at least in the gameplay but the pc port is horrible xiii wasn t good either but is really bad on pc mainly because it has worst performance lots of low fps and fps drops and crashes randomly including when you save with the steam cloud active you can use the cloud to backup your save but i don t recommend you to use it as a regular save feature and sadly the game most likely won t be fixed and it s a shame a much better sequel with a much worst port if your pc can handle it and if you re ready to play a bad pc port i can recommend it ']

['as the middle chapter of the final fantasy trilogy i considered this game a must play after finishing ff final fantasy is the story of serah noel and the time rangers time is broken and it s up to them to solve history as time travel stories go i ve seen worse and more confusing ones gets going right out of the gate in stark contrast of ff which took about hours before it opened up in this game you can explore right from the the start the combat system is the same paradigm system from the first game with the added touch of monster taming tamed monsters fight with you in battle as part of your paradigms and most monsters in the game can be tamed each coming with their own active and passive benefits taming monsters became my thing as i sought out and farmed specific monsters to add to my party the combat system never got boring the story kept me interested until the end and the monster farming added a fun side thing to do sure this is a jrpg ass jrpg and got anime af at times but that s pretty much what i was expecting from a final fantasy game some people on here were griping about the frame rate but i never experienced any fps issues worth the purchase this game also has a primer that tells the story of final fantasy very well so you can skip the first game and not feel that you missed out on anything played on a toshiba satellite ramplayed on medium high settings with no noticable frame rate issues ']

['i outgrew liking jrpgs years ago now they re too tedious and filled with too much nonsense and yet i keep subjecting myself to them out of some oddly stubborn nostalgia and a kind of academic curiosity while i didn t particularly like how ffxiii the original played and found the story filled with far too much gobbledygook to be compelling i at least found things to like in some of the characters and the spectacle of it all impressive cutscenes settings is a game that i think fans of the genre would identify as better playing due to the more immediate access to its various systems however it s still an absolute grind fest if you want to exploit the upper limit of what the game has to offer extra hard optional bosses and such and if you don t then the game is still more or less on autopilot just like ffxiii as the gameplay doesn t appeal to me what i ve got left is the characters story and aesthetics all of which i found lacking noel and sarah are little bland the villain is much better but they re all entangled in a story built of such nonsense that it s hard to empathize with any of them the settings and presentation don t compare to a proper full ff game either on top of all that there are few rather despicable elements to this game that seem to actively hate its players in particular there s a casino in the game which has a slot machine with odds of winning that seem barely better than real life getting the game s bonus true ending is reliant in part on winning a big payout from this slot machine something which is entirely random and no in any way influenced by player skill this is completely ridiculous it s the worst kind of creatively bankrupt time sink and completely disrespectful to players even if i don t care about the bonus ending because i ll just watch a video of it the mere presence of something as insulting as completion being tied to a random number generator casts a shadow over the whole game finally as noted by many other reviews the performance is unacceptable to the extent that it does impact enjoyment of the game the game is internally locked to running either or because the gameplay engine is tightly coupled to the renderer and they hacked in support simply by halving the gameplay simulation speed and then only allowing the game to run at these two framerates instead of more sensibly decoupling the renderer from gameplay simulation that still wouldn t be too be to bad if the game could maintain all the time but even on hardware that should be more than sufficient to run the game at a solid and gtx it will constantly jump between and depending how much is on screen the frequent changes in framerate are jarring and arguably worse than if the game was simply locked to going to suffer through it and see it to the end because i m stubborn and compulsive about finishing games i start but it s going to be a struggle for sure ']

['while i personally felt largely positive towards final fantasy xiii this installment in the xiii series has left me feeling mostly frustrated and disappointed lightning was the focal point and poster girl of xiii but this time around you instead play as her sister serah normally i d have no problem with the idea of a spin off focusing on a different character however serah was probably one of the least interesting characters in the original game and i was never really thinking hey i sure would like to play as her unfortunately the supporting cast is pretty lacking and the second member of your party noel is nothing to write home about either this also leads me to my next problem with which is that you only have two members in your party the third slot being allocated to a monster of your choice the plot is one of the most convoluted and dull time travel stories i ve yet to see in a long while and at no point did this installment really ever feel warranted to me the gameplay and progression is changed up a bit this time the much criticized linearity of xiii has been somewhat remedied by adding branching levels which gives the player more options as to how they d like to progress the levels mostly feel pretty empty and dull with some nice scenery here or there lifeless npc s inhabit most of them providing lackluster side quests to keep you from progressing too quickly my biggest grievance however is that this port does not feel like it was given very much love or care your mileage may vary but even after installing an unofficial patch i suffered a lot of frame drops and low fps in the open world segments however menus and battles mostly remained smooth this doesn t seem excusable when my pc is capable of running games like gtav and the witcher on reasonably high settings at consistent frame rates i was fortunately able to tough it out through most of the slower segments of the game i should probably mention what i actually did like about the game you get a lot of the same quality scenery and pretty cutscenes that you should be familiar with from xiii it s got the same easy and action based combat that i enjoyed from the last installment the music is varied from the usual pretty tunes you expect from final fantasy to some perplexingly strange songs wild chocobo theme anyone the game doesn t seem to always take itself too seriously which is fine by me be ready for some goofy anime nonsense i could only really recommend this game on very particular circumstance while this review is mostly negative i did however enjoy a good portion of my time with it and for the price i felt satisfied it s a pretty bad port and i d imagine most wouldn t have the patience to complete the game because of this if the performance was improved i d easily recommend it on the basis of an impulse buy during a sale however you may just be better off skipping this installment there s a lot of better final fantasy games on steam ']

['just barely crosses my recommend threshold it is indeed a final fantasy game it has the requisite production values large scope interesting battle system monster variety and pretty much everything else you d expect square enix did well in taking a very different direction than the game s predecessor the ultra restricted linearity is gone replaced with far more explorable environments and at a macro level the ability to time hop it doesn t get much more nonlinear than that but the overall result is disappointing when it all comes down to it one of the central game mechanics becomes find and do as much as you can this kind of approach can be entirely functional and fun it works wonderfully for the mass effects elder scrolls and fallouts of the world the problem is that chooses to go the route of the pixel hunt that is hints and direction are quite sparse when they re around at all and certain things especially the archylte steppe come down to a process of walking around every inch of an area you ve already seen hoping to run across something new which character offers quests who knows what actually has an effect on this part of the gameworld who knows the mixture is both boring and frustrating which is not a recipe for a happy player now this kind of thing has been found in the final fantasy series before it s just that it s very very optional completing the game is usually about the core mechanics of character development and party management with some very powerful goodies thrown in for the person who pokes their nose into everything in poking your nose into everything is much more central to finishing the storyline and that can make it rather maddening the game suffers from a case of guide dang it where you would never logically figure out an element from gameplay alone more than any other final fantasy i ve like its predecessor also has a case of a suddenly steep difficulty curve you ll find a combat groove and it will work all the way to the end of the game and then the final battle occurs and looks like we need to go hunting around for more things in places we never thought to look let s try talking to everybody again again while getting attacked by monsters the whole way again some more sigh and then you finally get to the ending and it lacks any real payoff at all i can t say too much without spoiling things but my reaction pretty much sums up as they can t actually be serious about this can they as a final note i have to say that i just dislike the whole time travel and alternate universes thing it really worked for dr who but i find it thoroughly stale and disinteresting when used anywhere else it seems to always turn into a case of we just want to throw a bunch of random stuff together and so we ll explain it with time gates the game doesn t quite go that far it is decently written but my not being a fan of the central premise as a storytelling strategy doesn t make me want to award points to the title in summary really does improve on xiii in certain areas but it s still more obtuse than it ought to be also it really hits some sour notes with how it wraps itself up it was good enough to play through but if final fantasy were a band this would be one of the weakest albums in the catalog ']

['overall review is my review and opinions on this game overall i really enjoyed playing this game and am still building up the monster s for fun if you like rpg s you will probably like this game it might help to know the previous story in but honestly i had to re read most of it again since it s so complicated at times so really you can jump in at this game i think you ll find the graphics are nice and the animations are good its overall a very nice game to listen to and play but its not a very good ff game meaning that because its has ff in the front of its title its supposed to blow the doors off of the ride its just not that good so if you like rpg s you ll find the game to be a mix of chrono trigger with time travel and tomb raider with exploration and finding very hard to find fragements that are shaded dark and transparent so have fun with that without a guide the rest of the difficulty is just navigating the huge world where i feel it can slow the pacing old final fantasy games would frustrate me with the amount of battles and lack of story progress where as here the sheer size of the worlds to travel can take up time there are chocobo s to speed things up but still some maps are needlessly big a common square enix complaint of mine to much world not much interaction the music is good but for its ups it has downs i wouldn t play the ost front to back but playlist about half of it nice though overall the battle system is where its at this time you have only two character s aa bold rpg move but you have a rotating monster to fill the third spot this is fun but they are usually kinda weak untill late game so its helpful but sort of lacking as a real team member the story is cool but why is time travel just now making an appearance in series i don t think this is really all bad but it makes the world seem contrived and its just an odd feeling of the series being not a very well defined and formed rpg they just make these ff games ont the fly these days without much real originality its a very manufactured rpg for your enjoyment but that s like a person who tries hard to be your friend and makes thier life choices around you i would rather know they had a personality that was original and that i liked them anyways i respect that they made improvements based on what we didn t like in but why did they need to shouldn t they just make a good ff game that we are used to since the last true ff in many s opinion its been all over the place and honestly just play this game as an rpg and put up with the final fantasy in the title as just a title not the gameplay hint sad but true its still a good rpg and i reccoment it its very fun but very hard and the story is different but interesting albeit with very few actual characters most places have people in the towns but its not like they really are that interesting in my opinion i feel like this is a very kotor final fantasy actually but that could just be me if you like rpg s and action turn ['first thing first i would highly advise not playing this if you havent completed xiii already as while xiii is a game with serious flaws the story of it will directly be spoiled in like the first half hour of this game on the whole i enjoyed the game there are some underlying flaws but it left me with a positive experience playing through to the end the plot is very hard to follow in that sometimes it just doesn t make sense it s a time travel plot but where usually with this type of plot you change the past and the future changes here everything changes including the past as well as having a location and character in the opening sequence that falls out of time and you arent really sure whats going on the good it look s pretty even if things don t make sense the battle system is probably the best disguise for a bad system i ve seen in a long while auto battle command is back which lets the cpu choose the best actions round by round personally i like to issue commands manually only the thing is to do so will put you at a huge disadvantage manually issuing commands takes a couple seconds more while enemies still attack and prepare moves and the commands are very generic attack magic attack and four elements for the most part there are some battles with enemies where i couldn t even tell what was going on i found most battles i was glued to the hud without looking at the graphics etc you control one character while the ai controls the other as well as a tamed monster you can have i disliked this system too it had potential but did a bad job of explaining what monster stats were what benefit using monster a over monster b was or even the fact it doesnt flag rare monsters you encounter in the field up so you can easily pass them by character progression felt flat you can level according to what you prefer class wise but by the end of the game you realise that in the end you will end up the same as every other player as well the points you put into the system to level up dont seem to actually do much partially realted to being glued to the hud you don t notice your characters scoring that massive crit thanks to their new stats gear because well the numbers arent that impressive additionally the game seems to reward grinding and raw stats over strategy leaving many battles feeling unrewarding the game is not linear one of the main complaints many had with xiii did they take it a bit too far here maybe i would say no overall however the tools you use to unlock extra stages or unlock special skills or heck to even advance were very difficult to locate in levels without the assistance of a guide i didn t have too much issue finding my way to the end of the game but then going back and trying to unlock extra stages or locate and capture decent monsters is impossible to acheive in any sort of decent time without a guide performance wise it is a bad port but with a few tweaks it is bearable even fine if you have a good specced pc i run it on an gtx and aside from a few frame rate drops it has been fine after tweaking using nvidia s own graphics settings there are no meaningful graphics settings in the games menu so first thing you will want need to do is google up some reccomended settings and then change these directly in your gfx cards manufacturers tool expect to get around hours from the main story and exploring side branches of the story reasonably well post game ff fans may expect an uber boss there are a few in this however as mentioned before to even set about finding them or preparing for them you need a guide if i m using a guide to do everything i don t see the point in doing it so i will likely complete some of the dlc and retire from the game overall the hours have been enjoyable and i felt i have definately got my moneys worth ']

['part of the final fantasy xiii trilogy starts off fast and gets right into things the story is nicely carried over from the first xiii title and is generally presented pretty well we return to familiar faces along with some new ones the story starts off quite confusing and you are given tons of info pretty quickly it may seem messy at first due to alot of unexplained events and the time travel aspect can mix things up a little further however time travel in is mostly used as a way to get the game world to be opened up a bit and to move away from the linear direction that was ffxiii from this point of view its done well and doesnt really pose any issues as the story goes on it gets really intense i found myself at the edge of my seat a few times the graphics for the most part seem to be slightly improved over the first game and are really enjoyable the battle system is fantastic its simular to xiii with a bit of a twist with things like the mog clock allowing you to start off a battle with haste if timed well there is also the addition of pets and they act as the third member in your party the crystarium system is more streamlined and works really well the performance for some reason isnt as good as xiii and i find myself getting very varied frame rates this should not happen on a dollar pc that was purchased in overall its not too much of a problem however it certainly doesnt go unnoticed and its worth mentioning hopefully they improve on this for lightning returns boss fights feel very rewarding and fun encounter mechanics are fresh and interesting this game has one of the most memorable final boss fights ive experienced in ages there is a fair amount of grinding needed to be done to down the final boss but nothing too crazy the progression feels right they really nailed it here there is a great addition of skins in that are taken to the next level in lightning returns something that i rate very highly as i love customization in any game there is a lack of cg cutscenes in i would have liked a little more than the or they did for the game overall i found to be a fantastic sequel that is a must play for anyone that enjoyed final fantasy xiii you get the chance to delve further into lightning and serah s story i cant wait to jump into lightning returns this might be one of the best game trilogies ive played infact this game was the reason i will continue to invest my time and money into the franchise and purchase a to contine the legacy that is final fantasy would thank square enix again and again and again for porting this to']

['tl dr it feels like dlc turned in to a full game but there are major improvements changes that make it interesting enough to warrent a purchase the graphics seem worse than xiii yet the assets look like they were pulled directly from the previous game the story is the weaker element not as good as xiii yet the gameplay improved on everything that was annoying about xiii it s a good title it holds up as it s own game but it s not something that will keep you hooked i jumped right in to just moments after finishing xiii so comparisons will be made between the two this review will concentrate on the changes made from xiii to as the games are so similar that if you did like xiii then you will most likely enjoy this it feels like dlc turned in to a full game what i mean by this is that it feels like they had a cool idea to play as serah in an expansion to xiii but opted to turn it in to it s own game this is common in the industry just take a look at saints row it was originally a dlc for saints row the third with that being said it is a fun game to play though at first glance it is misleading with lightning s character model and face plastered all over the place it is easy for one to think that she is the focus of the game she is in a sense but not in the playable kind she is the starting focus of the story serah is your playable character in this game a long with a boy called noel graphics wise it actually looks worse than the original xiii to me but that could be down to the port itself gameplay wise itis more of the same only they scrolled things back a bit in terms of enemy encounters you can no longer see the enemies in full view as you could in xiii encounters work on a detection system where enemies will randomly appear as you are running around you can either try to run or attack them it s a sort of ballance between the way encounters worked in xiii and how encounters worked in the old school games the combat system as been revamped somewhat though it does feel a hell of a lot slower even when using the haste ability one of the major improvements is ability to switch party leader mid battle this also means that the battle is not over if your current party leader goes down in battle it simply switches to the next person so you can continue the fight the major update though is the addition of monsters you can now tame monsters you encounter through no special mechanic you simply beat a monster and sometimes it will drop a crystal wich adds that monster to your collection these monsters act as your third party member in combat each one having a specific role from the same pool of character roles that you saw in xiii these monsters can not become party leader and have the same behavior as any ai set in whatever role it happens to be in but with a unique twist every monster has it s own special attack which can be used by incrasing the feral link gauge this gauge works very similar to the gestalt and tp gauge from xiii once full you can activate a special attack which then starts a qte to determine a damage boost to said attack via a sync level how fast you complete the qte prompts determines your sync percentage which determines the damage boost for the attack each monster has it s very own unique attack each with different attributes the leveling system has also changed a fair bit the crystarium is back but in a different way rather than all roles having their own seperate progression track all roles are now on the same track which i honestly do prefer because builds are now a viable option the crystarium also expands automatically rather than in key points of the story once you reach the end of what is currently available the track will then expand you can then pick a bonus the bonuses are pretty cool you can pick a boost the roles you have unlocked unlock a new role or increase your accessory capacity the crystarium is also available for your monsters though you can not use cp to upgrade them instead you use componants to progress them but it still works in the same way the main difference beign you can not change the role of a monster each monster has it s own set role an dunique progression track they made a big change to the way you equip accessories in xiii you started with one slot and unlocked more as you progressed here you start with three and can still unlock more except now you have a capacity each accessory has a number next to it for example a ring has a value of your capacity is if you want to equip a second accessory you will needd to find one that doesn t go above the remaining capacity example case being your capacity can of course be upgrade via the crystarium expansion bonuses all in all it is a decen entry far from being the best and story wise it isn t as good as xiii but gameplay wise it adds enough new mechanics to edge ahead of xiii it s worth it for the price give a try ']

['is such a good game that it almost makes me like ffxiii in retrospect almost first let s just get the elephant in the room out of the way yes this port is terribly optimized it may work fine for some but i played at with drops with is really pretty abysmal the only thing this has over playing on console is resolution and the ability to use the japanese audio the japanese audio by the way is fantastic so now on to the good i played through ffxiii and really hated the experience by the end and still consider it the worst entry in the franchise then this game comes along and basically fixes every problem i had with the original paradigm switching is now instant a no brainer change really but it changes the pace of battle so much when you don t have to watch the camera stupidly focus in on every party member one at a time for each paradigm shift you can now tame wild monsters and have them fight along side you this not only goes a long way towards offering the player choice in how to compose their party early on but it s also just a lot of fun finding badass or adorable monsters and taming them the game just generally utilizes the game mechanics much more i was forced to rapidly switch between paradigms and change up my party compositions so much more than the original boss fights typically include qte s to finish off the fight some might take issue with this but i liked them and it made beating bosses feel really satisfying reminded me of bayonetta enemies no longer appear in the field all the time but rather randomly show up in circle around you as you walk around this isn t reeeaaally a positive or negative change but what is better is that you now have a dedicated attack button to get the drop on enemies instead of runnung around in circles like an idiot tryng to run into enemies from behind like in the original actually there is a negative to be mentioned here difficulty spikes i have no problem with challenging games but when a section or boss comes out of nowhere and just wipes the floor with you repeatedly it tends to raise an eyebrow this thankfully only happened to me twice once in the middle and then final crazy boss but it was more than a little annoying the original game had you do things and things only walk forward and fight enemies not only gets you up and running with all the game mechanics much quicker but generally has a greater amount of variety in it s gameplay including actual sidequests and lots of em npc s to talk to and interact with lots of those too branching pathways and areas that aren t a simple straight line monsters to tame and level up fight with a chocobo at your side you have an adorable moogle companion who you can throw yes throw to reach far away treasure a small but hilarious addition the crystarium has been changed it s still a pretty linear affair but every time you fill up a full grid or screen or whatever you can choose a big reward like adding a new section to the atb guage or even unlocking a new role i was completely sick of most of the characters in ffxiii by the time i was through with it serah and noel are thankfully handled in a much better fashion i found serah to be likeable from the get go and while her motivations aren t really that deep i just want to see my sister again she s characterized really well and her sincerity is really charming then noel is like ff s version of riku minus the being a d ck to the main character part both have really solid voice acting whether playing in japanese or english this game is also pretty dark which might not be what you expect from looking at it the farther and farther into the future you travel the more hopeless things become this sense of desperation to me is the heart of final fantasy on a similar note the time travelling is a lot of fun seeing how the world and characters change depending on what time period or even timeline they re in is really interesting there s a good chance you ll get sick of hearing the word paradox though you ve been warned the soundtrack is phenominal the original certainly wasn t dragging it s feet in this department but i feel like it fell a bit short of pulling off a different sounding ff score absolutely pulls it off the three composers have put together an awesome collection of beautiful tracks ranging from the classic ff sounds to some more electronically infused numbers and best of all a handfull of tracks that include vocals the new bodhum theme alone sets this score apart the game s a looker no doubt about that special mention goes to the animation however as i think square is really great at animating their characters and especially faces there is one more negative however and that s how the game handles it s ending to see the real ending you have to play a thankfully included dlc chapter that is incredibly tedious and feels entirely divorced from the whole experience it s weird that square would get such a huge amount of things right in this game and then bork up the delivery of the ending yeah just weird that aside i can t recommend this game enough if you already liked the first then you robably didn t need any convincing anyway but if you are like me and hated the original then i have to urge you to give this one a shot it s not often that a studio puts in this much effort into fixing a game so when they do i think they deserve to be rewarded ']

['final fantasy games have always been tied together by common motifs crystals summons chocobos airships and yoshitaka amano s klimt esque concept art in final fantasy both towns and exploration were discarded as extraneous trappings unnecessary to lightning s mission or as it was referred to in the game s terminology her focus in however the towns are back with sprawling areas filled with people to talk to for tackling on side quests in my opinion recaptures what was lost in the series s heritage is a game about time traveling and multiverses searh farron the main protagonist of this game is on a quest to search for her lost older sister claire farron the idea of including monsters pets to have their own development trees and can be named dressed and even fed other captured monsters in order to inherit their abilities is amazing the customization of developing your characters on a molecular level then at a squad composition level can be immensely satisfying i run this game on high settings at average of however the fps dips down to in combat which is bareable i wish there were more graphics options to tinker with to make this game but for a console port it is manageable ']

['if you found the story of this games predecessor a little convoluted you re going to want to give this one a miss this game takes the incredible story of the original including the lengthy cut scenes and continues it on a path filled with complex time travel paradoxes which i m still not convinced make complete sense otherwise it s definitely worth picking up for any fan of the series i did feel however that the changes made to the battle and crystarium systems were a little unnecessary and didn t work quite as well as those in the original despite being a lot more open and free roaming than the original which is commonly referred to as a corridor simulator because of its linearity this game is approximately half the length of the last but does offer lots of replayability if you so desire it s also worth mentioning that this game does thankfully contain the advanced graphics options that were recently introduced with xiii but does unfortunately suffer from the same performance issues manifested in some pretty serious dips in framerate the game dosn t come anywhere near being considered as unplayable because of it it s just something to bear in mind if dropping below angers you overall a very solid final fantasy game overshadowed slightly by its predecessor but not enough to stop me from being keen to play the finale to the trilogy when it releases on steam ps i d also recommend finding the guide in the community page which explains how to patch in serah s character skin from the original to replace the gaudy bikini skin se for some reason thought was a good idea ']
